name: Copacabana, Brazil
description: For sunning, relaxing and people watching, join the thousands who flock each year to this lively, world-famous beach lined with shops, bars, restaurants and hotels.

name: Camps Bay Beach, South Africa
description: Camps Bay Beach is probably the most popular beach among tourists when they visit Cape Town in the summer months. However, locals appreciate it just as much and itâ€™s a great spot for families, swimmers and sunbathers.

name: Great Pyramid of Giza, Egypt
description: The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tomb of pharaoh Khufu, and still contains his granite sarcophagus. It had, like other tombs of Egyptian elites, four main purposes: It housed the body of the deceased and kept it safe. It demonstrated the status of the deceased and his family.

name: Machu Picchu, Peru
description: The Temple of the Sun in Machu Picchu, a semi-circular structure, was a sacred Inca site used for ceremonial and astronomical purposes, showcasing their advanced stonework and astronomical understanding, particularly in relation to the sun god Inti.

name: Prasat Bayon, Cambodia
description: The Bayon Temple, located in the heart of Angkor Thom, Cambodia, is renowned for its unique architectural feature of giant stone carvings of smiling faces adorning its towers, making it a must-see attraction.

name: Iguazu Falls, Brazil
description: The colossal power of these thundering falls, viewable from both Argentina and Brazil, and accessible from Paraguay, is a mesmerizing sight: 275 separate falls in a U-shaped formation pound the water below in raging cascades with a deafening intensity.
